description: Fermat's Last Theorem: a(n) = 1 if x^n+y^n=z^n has a nontrivial solution in integers, otherwise a(n) = 0.
comments: a(n) is the Hankel transform of A000045(n), n>=1 (Fibonacci numbers). See A055879 for the definition of Hankel transform. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 23 20071, -1, 0, 0, 0, ... is the convolutional inverse of the all-ones sequence. - _Tanya Khovanova_, Jun 29 2007Also parity of the Euler totient function A000010. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 15 2012

formula: a(n) = (-1)^n*sum{k=0..floor(n/2), (-1)^A010060(n-2k)mod(C(n, 2k), 2)}. - _Paul Barry_, Jan 03 2005a(n) = 1-[(n+2) mod (n+1)]+[n!^2 mod (n+1)]*[(n+1)!^2 mod (n+2)]. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Aug 29 2007a(n) = [(n-1)! mod 2], with n>=1. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Feb 15 2008a(n+1) = (1/2)*[1+(-1)^n]*a(n), with a(0)=1. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 16 2008Euler transform of length 2 sequence [1, -1]. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 05 2009a(n) is multiplicative with a(2) = 1, a(2^e) = 0 if e>1, a(p^e) = 0^e if p>2. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 05 2009G.f.: x + x^2 = x * (1 - x^2) / (1 - x). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 05 2009Dirichlet g.f.: 1 + 2^(-s). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 05 2009a(n) = A171386(n+1). - _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Dec 12 2009a(n) = A169611(prime(n)). - _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Dec 07 2009a(n) = A000035(A000010(n)). - _Omar E. Pol_, Oct 28 2013
crossrefs: INVERT transform gives Fibonacci numbers, A000045.
Convolution inverse of A062157. Dirichlet convolution inverse of A154269.
Cf. A229382, A229383 (near-miss counterexamples to FLT).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
